title.rendered: How to Take Advantage of Online Poker in the State of New Jersey?

content.rendered:
New Jersey has always been the hub of gambling outside Nevada. And if swanky casinos weren’t enough incentive for tourists and locals alike, the state opened its doors to online casinos. Virtual poker remains a crowd favorite, and although not all operators offer similar services, there is no dearth of options in the state.

However, players must familiarize themselves with the latest laws before jumping on the bandwagon, as the bar is set much higher than it was a decade back. So, whether you regularly cross state borders to fuel your hobby or are just looking for some fun over the weekend, New Jersey has something in store for everybody!

Getting Started with Online Poker in NJ

The registration process is quite stringent for online gambling, and the Division of Gaming Enforcement (DGE) observes the highest security measures to ensure the best experience. Players wishing to sign up must register with their name, address, and DOB apart from their Social Security Number, which might come as a shock for many. However, the SSN plays a critical role in upholding the integrity of the ID verification process.

NJ online casinos come with their fair share of technical difficulties. Credit card transactions, for instance, rely on pure luck to get through. While Visa cardholders have a 50-50 chance of successfully funding their casino account at the first attempt, MasterCard users have a slightly higher edge at 75%.

However, since the banks refuse to upgrade their age-old transaction policies regarding online gambling, modern casinos and sportsbooks have worked their way around the problem. Online operators have started accepting non-conventional payment forms like eWallets and cryptocurrency.

The Online Poker Scene in New Jersey

A whole bunch of reputed multi-table tournaments are hosted in NJ every week. These events advertise massive prize pools to draw in poker enthusiasts and veterans from around the state. While Texas Hold’em continues to be the crowd-favorite, a few events featuring Omaha is steadily gaining popularity.

Players looking for a more relaxing experience can try their hands at Sit & Go tournaments. These tables usually host Texas Hold’em with a $1 buy-in. Pot Limit Omaha and Pot Limit Omaha High/Low are sometimes available during peak hours. Although the Pot changes over time, you can still enjoy a good game of poker at these tables. Sit & Go tournaments can have spread-limits up to $200.

However, the most popular NJ online poker tournament has to be No-Limit Texas Hold’em. Its popularity is evident as almost every online poker site is a dedicated Texas Hold’em platform hosting other games on the side. If you prefer poker tournaments over cash games, NJ casinos are where the action is at!

If you are a fan of online poker tournaments in NJ, there’s a whole list of reputed websites that you can sign up on. NJPunter compares the most reliable operators, helping you make an informed decision every time.
